intro: Deinbollia neglecta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and velvety, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Deinbollia neglecta prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
